description: Unclear; possibly from Min Nan 白毫 (pe̍h-ho, “white hair”) or Min Nan 白花 (pe̍h-hoe, “white flower”). See Tea leaf grading#Etymology. Compare to Russian ба́йховый (bájxovyj).

entries.meaning: A high-quality black tea made using young leaves, grown in Sri Lanka, India, Java and the Azores.
